summary:
As a global citizen I am infused with multiple cultures, languages and skills that in retrospect, one could only gain by living and working across different countries. On my path, I have challenged myself to refine a deep understanding of several industries, growing a uniquely rich skill set and approach along the way. I am used to a very diverse and cross-cultural environment having managed a number of international projects and multi-disciplinary teams. Having also been deeply involved in implementing these projects, I have developed a passion for innovation and collaboration at a large and often very complex scale. I am eager to evaluate and interpret the holistic picture, zooming out to broader perspectives and zooming back in to bring details into sharp focus for the projects I manage.

With my background in law, I also possess both strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills. I find practical solutions for daily challenges. Being a passioned learner, I have studied Project Management at the University of Massachusetts Boston and have obtained the Project Management Professional (PMP) certification, in addition to my Master’s Degree in Law.  Most recently, I have obtained a professional diploma in Strategy, Development and Innovation from the UCD Michael Smurfit Graduate Business School. 

I’m always excited to work for vibrant communities with a strong vision where I thrive on daily change. I aspire to remove the barriers that often restrict efficiency and communication across multi-disciplinary teams while connecting dots to discover new opportunities to collaborate and innovate. I truly believe that in order to make meaningful and impactful things, different people with a multitude of skills must find a way to work together.

Award was granted for my master thesis “Legal Regulation of Mobbing in the Workplace”.

projects.title: iSCAPE - Improving the Smart Control of Air Pollution in Europe
projects.description:
iSCAPE (2016-2019) is a €6m Horizon 2020 project led by UCD. It involves 15 partner organizations across Europe. The overall objective of iSCAPE is to develop an integrated strategy for air pollution control in European cities that is grounded on evidence-based analysis. iSCAPE aims at reducing urban pollution and climate change negative impacts by leveraging Passive Control Systems, Behavioral Change, and the Living Lab approach. This includes:
•	Introducing Passive Control Systems such as low boundary walls, trees and hedge-rows, green walls and roofs, photocatalytic coatings and green urban spaces to affect the dispersion of pollutants. 
•	Embracing smart city technology by deploying a network of low-cost interconnected air quality sensors to gather real-time data.
•	 Creating Living Labs in each of the pilot cities (Dublin, Bottrop, Bologna, Vantaa, Hasselt, and Guilford) to bring together scientists, businesses, city stakeholders and citizens in an open collaborative spirit for the deployment and testing of these interventions. 
•	Training citizens with air quality monitoring kits to increase their awareness about air pollution and foster behavioral change through education.
•	Sharing the results of these innovations with policy-makers and planners to make cities less harmful to the local climate and help create cleaner air for everyone.

projects.title: Smart e-Tourism
projects.description:
Smart e-Tourism project (5/2012-12/2014) was aimed to increase regional tourism attractiveness by developing e-tourism solutions using state-of-the-art information technologies. In addition, project was targeted to develop an e-tourism framework facilitating tourism marketing activities and use of regional tourism services and infrastructure. 

3D virtual representation of the renowned tourism destination in the Republic of Karelia - Kizhi Island, is one of the examples of successful cross-border cooperation. Accessible over the Internet, 3D Virtual Kizhi Island facilitates prospective tourist decision-making process by providing informative and entertaining setting, as well as unique immersive and engaging virtual experiences and social interactions. During the project, 10 pilot e-Tourism solutions for regional application were developed.

The project implementation involved strong collaboration between project partners:
- Petrozavodsk State University (lead partner) 
- Center for Internet Excellence, University of Oulu
- FRUCT Oy 
- St. Petersburg Institute for Informatics and Automation of Russian Academy of Sciences
- Tourist Information Centre of the Republic of Karelia

This project was implemented within the framework of Karelia ENPI CBC Programme (http://www.kareliaenpi.eu/) funded by the European Union, Finland and Russia.

contributors.headline: Postdoctoral Researcher at Center for Ubiquitous Computing
Associate Professor at Petrozavodsk State University

projects.title: Social Navigator
projects.description:
This project (05/2013-12/2014) was aimed to improve quality of life of people with disabilities by addressing social issues related to social exclusion, accessibility and mobility of disabled people using advanced Information and Communication Technologies. During the project,  a user friendly ecosystem of digital services and mobile applications for people with disabilities – Social Navigator was developed.

In the project implementation following partners from both Finland and Russia were involved:
- Petrozavodsk State University (lead partner) 
- Center for Internet Excellence, University of Oulu
- FRUCT Oy 
- Ministry of Health and Social Development of Karelia

This project was implemented within the framework of Karelia ENPI CBC Programme (http://www.kareliaenpi.eu/) funded by the European Union, Finland and Russia.

projects.title: Complex development of regional cooperation in the field of open ICT innovations
projects.description:
It was a three-year project (4/2011-7/2014) implemented in the Republic of Karelia, Russia and Oulu, Finland.
The project developed and further enhanced regional competences in the field of open ICT innovations by establishing proper R&D&I infrastructure, and enabling cross-border educational, research and development activities. In addition, it created a vivid platform for regional cooperation by organizing international conferences, intensive courses, workshops, trainings, and seminars to foster mutual understanding and knowledge sharing between industry and academy representatives from both countries.  
In the project implementation following partners from both Finland and Russia were involved:
- Petrozavodsk State University - lead partner
- Center for Internet Excellence, University of Oulu - partner
- Open Innovation Association FRUCT (Finnish-Russian University Cooperation in Telecommunications) - associated partner

This project was implemented within the framework of Karelia ENPI CBC Programme (http://www.kareliaenpi.eu/) funded by the European Union, Finland and Russia.

projects.title: MAINIO - Methods And Innovation Networks In OULLabs
projects.description: MAINIO project (1/2012–6/2014) was aimed to enhance the concept of user-driven product and service development and user-driven innovation methods. During this project,  OULLabs innovation network (Oulu Urban Living Labs, http://www.oullabs.fi/en/) was further extended.

profile_positions.description:
EIT Climate-KIC is a Europe’s leading public-private innovation partnership focused on mitigating and adapting to climate change and offering systems innovation as a service to governments, regions, cities or community leaders. As a Programme Manager, I’m responsible for managing the delivery of a large-scale systems innovation program aimed at accelerating Slovenia’s transition to a circular economy.

- Managed and coordinated the delivery of the Slovenia Deep Demonstration programme, including strategic and operational planning, stakeholder requirement management, budget oversight, resource planning, risk management, progress monitoring and reporting. 
- Developed a second phase multi-year work program, offering systems innovation as a service to the Slovenian government and key local stakeholders.
- Designed and continuously improved internal ways of working to ensure program objectives are met within constraints of time, quality, and allocated budget.
profile_positions.title: Programme Manager

profile_positions.description:
Trinomics is an independent international consultancy company that provides research and policy advisory services in the fields of energy, environment, and climate change. As a Business Operations Manager, I was responsible for managing business processes, new project acquisition and contract management.

- Business process development and continuous improvements to optimize operational efficiency and collaboration with consultants, cluster leads and the managing director. 
- Project acquisition, ensuring compliance with tender specifications and requirements. 
- Contract management and execution with various clients (European Commission, national and international organisations/ funders), project partners, and subcontractors.
profile_positions.title: Business Operations Manager

profile_positions.description:
- Managed a large scale international project (iSCAPE) involving 15 partner organizations across Europe.
- Ensured efficient project implementation such that project objectives are met within the constraints of time, quality, and allocated budget and all project partners are working towards a common goal. 
- Strived to align interests and remove barriers to effective collaboration and communication between multi-disciplinary teams. 
- Developed strategic relationships and identified collaboration opportunities while building a new consortium with 39 organizations from 17 different countries and submitting a project proposal to the European Union’s H2020 program.
- Drove concept development processes resulting in a novel framework for making cities socially inclusive through co-designed nature-based solutions.
- Oversaw innovation activities and designed implementation processes for Dublin Living Lab following a user-centred approach that brings together a wide range of stakeholder to develop and test new solutions in a real-life setting. 
- Applied design thinking in organizing co-creation workshops and ideation sessions for both internal and public events.   
- Developed project documentation, including project deliverables, guidelines, and status reports.
profile_positions.title: International Project Manager

company.name: Safety and Benefit Risk Management (SABR), Biogen

profile_positions.description:
- Promoted from a Manager to Senior Manager position, providing leadership and oversight for the contract development processes within the Safety and Benefit Risk Management (SABR) department after a short, 6-month period.
- Served as a primary point of contact for contractual matters and provided guidance on applicable company policies and procedures to ensure compliant contract execution and swift problem solving.
- Drove the development of contract management vision and authored departmental guidance documentation to promote further awareness of contracting practice.
- Identified opportunities to implement process improvements resulting in increased operational efficiency.   
- Managed contract lifecycle for Health Care Provider Consulting Agreements, Master Service Agreements and Statements of Work, Confidentiality Agreements, Sponsored Research Agreements, and other ad-hoc agreements as needed.
- Evaluated, drafted, and executed multiple agreements simultaneously by managing competing priorities and time constraints.
- Interfaced with cross-functional stakeholders (e.g. Finance, Legal, Corporate Compliance, Procurement) along with functional subject matters to ensure all prerequisites for contract execution are met.
- Trained and mentored a contract manager by transferring an extensive knowledge base and effective approach to contract management in a dynamic environment.
profile_positions.title: Senior Manager, Contract Management

profile_positions.description:
- Co-directed and co-managed 3 international projects involving up to 5 partner organizations from Finland and Russia.
- Demonstrated exceptional communication skills by successfully addressing challenges of cross-cultural communication.
- Established strong working relationships between the project partners and external stakeholders from both countries, as well as enhanced and strengthened cross-border cooperation between the Oulu region (Finland) and the Republic of Karelia (Russia).
- Facilitated development of novel IT applications in the expanding domains of e-tourism (Kizhi Island 3D model, for example) and mobile healthcare and social wellbeing.
- Delivered project-related documentation including state-of-the-art studies and evaluations, project progress and expenditure reports.
- Disseminated project results by participating in international fairs and exhibitions, press conferences, as well as by writing press announcements and scientific publications.
- Hosted and organized 2 international conferences (up to 200 participants), cross-border workshops, trainings and multi-disciplinary seminars.
- Experienced in all aspects of project management, including initiation, planning, execution, monitoring, and closing.
profile_positions.title: Project Coordinator

company.name: The Office of Sworn Bailiff Ginters Hmelevskis

profile_positions.company: The Office of Sworn Bailiff Ginters Hmelevskis
profile_positions.description:
- Managed the debtor portfolio comprised of more than 500 enforcement matters.
- Executed enforcement proceedings in highly intense and fast-paced work environment.
- Demonstrated highly developed analytical and critical thinking skills resulting in effective decision-making and problem-solving for settling enforcement matters.
- Developed strong negotiation skills by communicating with debtors and creditors, the state and private institutions.
- Applied my theoretical knowledge to practice by preparing all legal documents with regard to the execution proceedings.

At the given time, Ginters Hmelevskis was the Chair of the Council of Latvian Sworn Bailiffs, the official body supervising Latvia's sworn bailiffs. Sworn bailiffs in Latvia are persons belonging to the court system and in their professional capacity bailiffs are equivalent to state officials.  Sworn bailiffs perform the execution of adjudications of the court and other institutions, as well as other activities prescribed by law. Their requirements and orders perfuming the official activities are binding of all persons in the state.
